title: Rug Fragment (USA), 1850–1900
medium:
Medium: worsted wool, jute
Technique: machine-made uncut tapestry pile
description: Dyed worsted wool woven under a surface weft. There is a bottom weft and two filler warps held together by jute "chains." Design consists of large-scale allover repeat with only small areas of the ground visible. Predominating are the large red and blue flowers with green leaves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Rug Fragment (USA), 1850–1900. Medium: worsted wool, jute
Technique: machine-made uncut tapestry pile. 
1941-77-1-b,c.
